Great question! 🌍 Climate change means long-term shifts in temperature and weather patterns. These changes are mostly caused by global warming — and they have huge impacts on the Earth and everything living on it.

🌡️ 1. Rising Temperatures
Average global temperatures are increasing.

This leads to heatwaves and longer summers.

🔥 Example: Some places are getting so hot, it’s dangerous to go outside during the day!

🧊 2. Melting Ice and Rising Sea Levels
Glaciers and polar ice caps are melting rapidly.

As a result, sea levels rise, flooding coastal cities and islands.

🏝️ Some small islands may disappear underwater!

🌪️ 3. Extreme Weather Events
More storms, floods, cyclones, and wildfires are happening.

Weather is becoming less predictable and more dangerous.

⛈️ Some areas face heavy rain, while others suffer from droughts.

🌾 4. Impact on Agriculture and Food
Crops don’t grow well in extreme heat or floods.

Farmers face problems like low crop yield and soil erosion.

This can lead to food shortages and higher prices.

🐾 5. Harm to Animals and Plants
Many species are losing their homes due to changing climates.

🐧 Polar animals like penguins and polar bears are at risk.

🐝 Some insects and plants are disappearing, affecting the entire food chain.

💧 6. Water Scarcity
Less rainfall and dried-up rivers mean less drinking water.

Some areas may face water wars in the future!

🧍 7. Health Problems
Hotter weather spreads diseases like dengue and malaria faster.

People may suffer from dehydration, breathing problems, or heat strokes.
